attributes.action: consider building a minimum of 1500 new prisons to cater for the massive scale of civil disobedience that will follow if road pricing is introduced. We the petitioners will most likely be taking part in this civil disobedience.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: The Prime Minister and his Government seem to have chosen to ignore the unprecedented support for the anti road pricing petition, and intend to continue with the plan and local trials for the system. This scheme will prove even more unpopular than the Poll Tax, and will undoubtedly result in civil disobedience on a massive scale: If the Prime Minister intends to persist with the introduction of it then he must also plan ahead to deal with this civil disobedience, if each prison were able to house 1000 inmates then 1500 would seem a conservative (pardon the use of the word Prime Minister) estimate of the likely need in view of the number of petitioners and far many more who will also rebel against the scheme.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
